member.name: P:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DB2EntityProviderSchemaConfig.DeleteDatabaseBehaviour
member.summary: Determines the behavior of the DeleteDatabase() function. Default value is DeleteDatabaseBehaviour.ModelObjectsOnly.

member.name: P:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DB2EntityProviderSchemaConfig.Authorization
member.summary: The name of the user who is the owner of the created schema. This option affect the CreateDatabase() behavior if the DeleteDatabaseBehaviour option is set to DeleteDatabaseBehaviour.Schema.

member.name: P:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DB2EntityProviderForeignKeyConfig.Enabled
member.summary: When set to false, this property makes the provider turn off the generation of foreign keys. This option affects the CreateDatabase() and Code-First Migrations behavior. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DB2EntityProviderForeignKeyConfig.IndexCreation
member.summary: When set to true, an index is created to the reference table columns. This option affects the CreateDatabase() behavior. The default value is true.

member.name: T:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DeleteDatabaseBehaviour
member.summary: Determines the behavior of the DeleteDatabase() functionality.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DeleteDatabaseBehaviour.ModelObjectsOnly
member.summary: Only the tables that model objects are mapped to are deleted. This is the default value.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DeleteDatabaseBehaviour.AllSchemaObjects
member.summary: All tables will be deleted from schemas that model objects were mapped to.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DeleteDatabaseBehaviour.Schema
member.summary: Entire schema is deleted. If the model contains objects from other schemas, these schemas will be deleted as well.

member.name: T:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DB2EntityProviderConfig
member.summary: Devart dotConnect for DB2 Entity Framework provider configuration.

member.name: P:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DB2EntityProviderConfig.SqlFormatting
member.summary: SQL formatting configuration.

member.name: P:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DB2EntityProviderConfig.QueryOptions
member.summary: SELECT commands configuration.

member.name: P:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DB2EntityProviderConfig.DmlOptions
member.summary: DML options influence only the INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE commands and Stored Procedure calls. SELECT commands are not affected by these options.

member.name: P:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DB2EntityProviderConfig.DatabaseScript
member.summary: Dynamic database generation/dropping configuration.

member.name: P:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DB2EntityProviderConfig.Workarounds
member.summary: Common workarounds.

member.name: P:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DB2EntityProviderConfig.CodeFirstOptions
member.summary: Code-First and Code-First Migrations options.

member.name: T:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DB2EntityProviderSqlFormattingConfig
member.summary: SQL formatting configuration.

member.name: P:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DB2EntityProviderSqlFormattingConfig.ExtraSpaces
member.summary: Determines whether to insert spaces between operators and operands and after commas. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DB2EntityProviderSqlFormattingConfig.MultilineStatements
member.summary: Determines whether to split statements to several lines. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DB2EntityProviderSqlFormattingConfig.Indenting
member.summary: Determines whether to indent keywords in multi-line queries. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DB2EntityProviderSqlFormattingConfig.ColumnListStacking
member.summary: Disables inserting new lines in the SELECT list. Default value is true.

member.name: T:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DB2EntityProviderQueryConfig
member.summary: SELECT commands configuration.

member.name: P:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DB2EntityProviderQueryConfig.NoEscapeLike
member.summary: The possibility to turn off ESCAPE in LIKE expression. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DB2EntityProviderQueryConfig.CaseInsensitiveLike
member.summary: The possibility to turn on the case insensitive comparison mode, when using Linq to Entities extension methods .Contains(), .EndsWith(), .StartsWith(). The default value is false.

member.name: P:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DB2EntityProviderQueryConfig.CaseInsensitiveComparison
member.summary: The possibility to turn on the case insensitive comparison mode, when using Linq to Entities comparison expression such as "a == b". The default value is false.

member.name: P:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DB2EntityProviderQueryConfig.UseCSharpNullComparisonBehavior
member.summary: The default value is false.

member.name: P:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DB2EntityProviderQueryConfig.ParametersAsLiterals
member.summary: The default value is false.

member.name: T:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.InsertNullBehaviour
member.summary: Determines how the NULL values are inserted.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.InsertNullBehaviour.InsertNull
member.summary: In this case nulls are inserted explicitly (for each column that do not have a non-NULL value specified).

member.name: F:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.InsertNullBehaviour.InsertDefaultOrNull
member.summary: In this case provider determines if there is a default value specified in the SSDL part of the model, and if it is available, this value is persisted to database. If there is no default value specified, the behaviour is identical to the InsertNull one.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.InsertNullBehaviour.InsertDefaultOrOmit
member.summary: In this case provider determines if there is a default value specified in the SSDL part of the model as well. However, if there is no default value specified for a column, it is omitted from the INSERT command completely.

member.name: F:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.InsertNullBehaviour.Omit
member.summary: In this case provider simply omits all columns that do not have non-NULL values.

member.name: T:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DB2EntityProviderDmlConfig
member.summary: DML options influence only the INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE commands and Stored Procedure calls. SELECT commands are not affected by these options.

member.name: P:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DB2EntityProviderDmlConfig.ParametersAsLiterals
member.summary: Determines if parameter values are inserted into SQL statements as literals instead of parameters. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DB2EntityProviderDmlConfig.InsertNullBehaviour
member.summary: Determines how the NULL values are inserted. Default value is InsertNullBehaviour.InsertNull.

member.name: P:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DB2EntityProviderDmlConfig.ReuseParameters
member.summary: Enables reusing existing parameters instead of creating a new ones. Set this property to true only in case if a large number of the same values is sent to the database. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DB2EntityProviderDmlConfig.EmptyUpdates
member.summary: When set to false, this property makes the provider turn off the generation of fake updates for parent entities. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DB2EntityProviderDmlConfig.BatchUpdates
member.summary: Batch Updates functionality configuration.

member.name: T:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DB2EntityProviderBatchUpdateConfig
member.summary: Batch Updates functionality configuration.

member.name: P:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DB2EntityProviderBatchUpdateConfig.Enabled
member.summary: Enables or disables Batch Updates functionality. If set to false, other BatchUpdates settings are ignored. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DB2EntityProviderBatchUpdateConfig.BatchSize
member.summary: Specifies the maximal number of commands in a batch. Default value is 30.

member.name: P:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DB2EntityProviderBatchUpdateConfig.AsynchronousBatch
member.summary: Specifies whether batches are executed asynchronously (false by default), or new batch will be created and executed only after the successful execution of the previous batch. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DB2EntityProviderBatchUpdateConfig.ConcurrencyCheck
member.summary: Enables or disables concurrency check. If set to true, BatchStoredProcedures must be set to false. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DB2EntityProviderBatchUpdateConfig.BatchStoredProcedures
member.summary: Specifies whether stored procedure calls can be included in batches. If set to true, ConcurrencyCheck must be set to false. Default value is false.

member.name: T:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DB2EntityProviderWorkaroundConfig
member.summary: Common workarounds.

member.name: P:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DB2EntityProviderWorkaroundConfig.IgnoreSchemaName
member.summary: When set to true, this property makes provider to remove the schema (database) name from all commands and queries, no matter whether Schema specified in the model or not. Command will be using the schema from the connection. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DB2EntityProviderWorkaroundConfig.IgnoreDboSchemaName
member.summary: When set to true, this property makes provider to remove the "dbo" schema (database) name from all commands and queries. Command will be using the schema from the connection. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DB2EntityProviderWorkaroundConfig.DisableQuoting
member.summary: Disables quoting all identifiers in all queries and commands. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DB2EntityProviderWorkaroundConfig.UseInvariantProviderManifestToken
member.summary: If set to true, the invariant string literal is always returned as the provider manifest token. Default value is false.

member.name: T:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DB2EntityProviderCodeFirstConfig
member.summary: Code-First and Code-First Migrations options.

member.name: P:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DB2EntityProviderCodeFirstConfig.RemoveSchemaFromDefaultConstraintName
member.summary: When set to true, the schema (database) name prefix is removed from default constraint names (primary keys, foreign keys) generated by Code-First Migrations. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DB2EntityProviderCodeFirstConfig.AddTableNameInDefaultIndexName
member.summary: When set to true, the table name is added to default index name generated by Code-First Migrations (like 'IX_TableName_ColumnName'). When set to false, then default index names will be like 'IX_ColumnName'. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DB2EntityProviderCodeFirstConfig.UseNonUnicodeStrings
member.summary: When set to true, string properties without an explicitly specified server data type will be treated as non-unicode. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DB2EntityProviderCodeFirstConfig.UseNonLobStrings
member.summary: When set to true, string properties without an explicitly specified server data type will be treated as non-LOB. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Devart.Data.DB2.Entity.Configuration.DB2EntityProviderCodeFirstConfig.TruncateLongDefaultNames
member.summary: When set to true, long default names of indexes, primary keys, and foreign keys, generated by Code-First Migrations, will be truncated and renamed if they exceed the limit of 128 characters. When set to false, an exception will be raised for long default names generated by Code-First Migrations if they are too long. This option does not affect the truncation of long default names generated by Code-First CreateDatabase() and DropDatabase() functionality. They are always truncated if they exceed the limit of 128 characters. However it affects the algorithm of this truncation and renaming of these identifiers. When it is set to true, the names of these identifiers are identical both in Code-First CreateDatabase() and in Code-First Migrations. Default value is true.
